candidates.reason: The comment directly discusses the same topic (drone propellers and noise reduction) described in the introduction, mentioning specific details such as uneven spacing and lower frequency.
candidates.comment: Stemming off from the previous Zipline drone. This video discusses how the drones are so silent. This is due to the uneven spacing of the drone’s propellers. When the propellers of the drones are spaced unevenly, it admit a lower frequency than if they were spaced proportionally to one another. This lower frequency is proposed as being quieter to the human ear, and therefore less annoying than the higher-pitched sound of a regular drone. However, the downside of this is that the wind speed of the drone is slower due to the turbulent flow being decreased. MIT is already researching this and has come up with several solutions to increase the turbulent flow while still maintaining the noise reduction.
candidates.url: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z58RORCUTao: How Do Zipline's Silent Propellers Work?
